column1: wide outside off, hint of swing, he drives over the top of it
inside edge! Forcing off the back foot, scoots pas the stumps and the keeper to fine leg
well bowled, hits a good length at off stump, gets squared up and it runs to backward point
back of a length outside off, driven square to point
strong punch into the off side and it's well fielded at cover...outfield looks quite heavy
fuller, wider outside off, slashed away off a top edge wide of the lone slip, third man is able to get across
round the wicket, worked off the back foot to the on side
terrific footwork, skips down the pitch and drives over mid-off. Very clean strike. And it just inches over the rope
back of a length, angled in at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
tucked off the stumps to midwicket
stays back, opens the face to a ball outside off and sends it to backward point
a touch short, he rocks back and hammers this pull wide of deep midwicket
back of a length at off stump, takes an inside edge and runs to the leg side
shorter outside off, he pulls over the top of it and it bounces well in front of the keeper
back of a length on leg stump, goes for the pull again and misses
and again, misses out on another pull, can't get the timing, the ball bobbles down by his feet
back of a length outside off, driven from the back foot into the cover ring
gets the pull away this time, back of a length and straight, not much pace in the pitch, sends it to deep square. Good start from Curran
a yorker at off stump, takes a thick edge into his boot
short of a length, goes for the pull and it bobbles into backward point off the bat
tries to bring out the scoop, goes across the crease and it comes off the back of the bat to the off side
excellent yorker, angled in at middle and leg, jabbed towards backward point
back of a length, straight, worked towards mid-on
moves outside leg, he follows him and fires it past the pads, the keeper can't reach it with a dive
full at off stump, driven to long-on
over the wicket, full at the stumps, driven to long-on
moves outside leg, it's a length delivery, drives into the covers
taken at deep midwicket! Trying to release the pressure, picks up a back-of-a-length delivery but can't get the distance. Nice simple catch for Kerr
full at off stump, driven to long-on
full outside off, pushed with an open face to cover
full again, taps into the covers and calls for the sharp single
back of a length, straight, walks across the crease and works to the leg side
driven off the back foot wide of the shorter cover fielder
back of a length, scuttles low outside off, takes an inside edge and doesn't carry to the keeper
full outside off, he givens himself room and drives crisply to cover
short down the leg side, he misses the pull but will be five to the total as he keeper can't get across
just over deep square! Was he too far in? Short on the pads, pulled firmly, it skims towards Vince and it goes over his out-stretched hand. That's a mistake from Vince
tickled fine with a lap-pull off his pads, poor line from Curran, neatly played and that makes it a good powerplay for the Hurricanes
over the wicket, back of a length at off stump, driven into the covers
appeal for lbw as he gets well across the crease, misses his flick to the leg side
back of a length outside off, tucked to deep midwicket
full outside off, driven to point
back of a length at off stump, driven wide of cover and long-off can't stop the second
punches neatly to cover
he gets greeted by the reverse sweep, taken off the stumps wide of short third man
pulled to long-on
short on the stumps, whipped off the back foot to deep midwicket
full and straight, driven to mid-off
driven into the off side
touch shorter, driven from the back foot to deep cover
full and straight, nudged past midwicket towards long-on
thumped! Excellent stroke, takes on a full delivery outside off, big stride towards the ball and a meaty swing through the line
goes fuller, whipped to deep midwicket
full outside off, driven to long-off
big appeal for lbw as he whips across the line of a full, straight delivery...that is VERY close! Ah, given a run so must have edged it
back of a length at off stump, miscues the pull off the bottom edge to deep square
full outside off, beats the inside edge as he plays a slightly flat-footed drive
good length outside off, a bottom-handed flick into the leg side and nicely weighted through midwicket
fuller, at off stump, flicked to long-on
that's a strong drive, full outside off, placed wide of the cover sweeper
and again, driven a touch more on the up this time, wide enough of the sweeper for another couple
short of a length outside off, worked around the corner to short fine leg
round the wicket, full outside leg stump, worked to long-on
goes for the sweep, an under edge between the keeper's legs
short outside off, cut to deep point
excellent catch at deep midwicket, brings out the slog-sweep and sends a skimming catch towards the rope which is very well held close to the ground. Super grab
very full at the stumps, dug out back to the bowler
lovely piece of bowling, wider outside off, draws him forward and there's a hint of turn to beat the edge
over the wicket, length ball outside off, driven to deep cover
well bowled, good length ball which squares him up and takes a thick outside edge to third man
driven in the air down to long-off
a slower ball, comes out as a full toss, played to long-off
edged, but doesn't carry to the keeper! Driving outside edge off and it dies off the edge
drives a low full toss to long-off to reach a very good fifty off 38 balls
fired very wide outside off, left alone and called
full outside off, driven firmly through the covers
shorter, outside off, driven off the back foot to deep cover

given caught, terrific catch away to his left at the second attempt! Short went for the slog-sweep, gets an inside edge into his leg which rebounds away and Philippe is very alert and keeps his cool (tough today!) to grab it after it pops up
round the wicket, flicks away from off stump to deep midwicket
driven into the covers
driven into the pitch and back to the bowler
back of a length at middle and leg, good line, he defends and gets a run to the covers
worked to the on side
driven off the back foot to deep cover
gets across the stumps and works a straight delivery backward of square, excellent running makes the second
tucked off the pads to deep square leg
beats the inside edge as he works across the line of a back-of-a-length ball outside off, not much carry as Bailey indicates
driven away from off stump square into the off side
that's a mighty blow...Bailey skips down the pitch and launches this over wide midwicket
good comeback, full at off stump, pushed through, defended to the on side
uses his feet again, well bowled as he sees him coming, pulls the length back and Bailey blocks
change of line, over the wicket, swept from outside off to deep backward square
round the wicket, full and straight, worked through midwicket to bring up the 100
angled down to third man
short of a length outside off, Bailey fetches it with a swattish pull through straight midwicket
swing and a miss outside off to a short-of-a-length delivery
driven off the back foot to deep cover
nicely bowled, defeats him with a slower ball offcutter outside off
on the pads, tucked into midwicket, Vince makes a bit of a mess of it to allow the second. Excellent over from Abbott, good changes of pace
excellent catch at point! Round the wicket, full at the stumps, takes a thick outside edge and a very good catch from Hughes moving to his right
stays round the wicket, full outside off, push on the front foot to cover
over the wicket, full toss on the pads, he's luck that only costs a single as Miller flicks straight to long leg
into the swinging arc and Milenko takes advantage, round the wicket, angles into the pads, picked up nicely over square leg
back outside off, takes the cue end to short third man
slower ball, angled in at leg stump, takes the pads
good catch at deep square! Back of a length outside off, he picks it up and a long way into the air and can't get the distance
full outside off, driven to long-off
full at the stumps, just beats Abbott to his right hand side as he slips trying to get across to it
picked up off the pads but only a single to deep square
across the crease and given! Big over from Abbott. This was a straight delivery, at middle and off, Faulkner had shuffled a long way across and that was pretty out
back of a length outside off, angled into backward point
down the pitch, swings and misses outside off. This innings going into reverse
fuller at the stumps, worked through square leg
finds cover! He won't get going at all. Short outside off, cracked it reasonably well off the back foot but straight to the man on the edge of the circle. Takes a look at the pitch
gets across outside off and scoops a short-of-a-length delivery wide of short fine leg
a slower ball, full outside off, waits for it and drives to long-off
short, angled into the body, pulled to deep square leg
starts with a slower ball full outside off, lofted straight down the ground
dug in short, pulled to deep square
moves early to outside off, has a swing at a full delivery and only gets fresh air
terrific shot, connects sweetly with a short-of-a-length slower ball outside off and sends it almost all the way to deep midwicket
you miss, I hit...Curran goes full and straight, Qais has a big swing
finds deep midwicket...full on off stump, connects pretty well but it's the long boundary and it doesn't quite have the distance
dragged down short and wide outside, dies off the surface
full outside off, a solid push to deep cover
full and straight, a strong bottom-handed clip through square leg
full at off stump, pushed firmly to mid-on
full, wide outside off, hint of swing, driven to the sweeper
full outside off, he's well across his stumps and pushes into the covers
direct hit from mid-on! Qais Ahmed with a superb piece of fielding. Was pushed firmly towards mid-on, Qais swoops with one hand and pulls off the perfect throw. He's well short
round the wicket, worked off the pads
uses his feet, pushes to the off side
that's a great shot, gives himself room outside leg and lofts inside-out over wide mid-off
and he goes again! This is bigger and long, lofted way back over long-off. Lovely clean swing through the line by Vince
low full toss on the pads, flicked backward of square
driven along the ground to long-off
full and straight, worked to the on side
walks at the bowler, a firm clip to mid-on for a sharp single
back of a length at leg stump, Philippe giving himself a touch of room, works to the leg side
round the wicket, swing and a miss, beats leg stump and also the keeper for some bonus...been a tough day for the keepers, although that wasn't a great piece of work from McDermott
short of a length, pulled strongly backward of square
length ball angled in, whipped to deep midwicket
angled in at the stumps, flicked in the air towards midwicket. Good save from Miller
that sounded great off the bat, picks up a back-of-a-length delivery which is right in the slot, swung miles back over deep square leg
fuller, a slower ball, clipped to midwicket
comes down the pitch and clubs a back-of-a-length delivery to midwicket
moves outside leg then drives into the covers, was in the air for a little, and a fielding fumble allows a second
down the pitch again outside leg stump, Milenko follows him and it's worked around the corner
good length at off stump, 145kph, takes a thickish inside edge to the leg side
back of a length outside off, Vince pulls and it goes under the bottom edge...147kph, so already the pace is up there
full outside off, pushed into the covers
full at off stump, moves outside leg and mistimes his drive back down the pitch...bit of confusion over the fielding but doesn't cost an extra run
beats the edge with a good length ball at 144kph which Vince tried to run to third man
a yorker at off stump, 146kph, jabbed to mid-off. That's an excellent first over
gets sent through midwicket first ball...an uncompromising front-foot swat as he picks up a length delivery
that's a strong drive on the up but he finds cover
low full toss which he follows him with, pushed to long-on
a slower ball on the stumps, tucked into square leg
follows him again outside leg, deflects off the pads to the on side
neatly forward into a full delivery, finds cover
short of a length, straight, pulled to deep square
cleans him up! Full at off stump, a well disguised offcutter slower ball, Vince aims a swipe to the leg side and misses
an appeal for a catch down the leg side, a short ball which Henriques pulls at...it's called wide
on off stump, back of a length, worked through square leg
banged in short, 142kph, not much timing on this pull to midwicket
full outside off, 140kph, played to backward point
full outside off, clipped backward of square
starts with a sharp leg-break which spins away and beats a big drive...they have gone upstairs to check the stumping. He's fine. By a long way
picks out long-off! He looked to have nailed this nicely with a booming lofted drive, but could hardly have placed it better to the fielder
short outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
short again, swung down to long-off
chopped into the off side
worked down to long-on
full and straight, worked off the pads to deep midwicket

massive moment, he finds deep midwicket! Full outside off, Philippe goes across outside off, down on one knee, aiming over the leg side but it's quite some way short and very well taken catch running in
short of a length slower ball, worked to fine leg and a misfield allows a second
full outside off, driven in the air towards mid-off
and given! What a passage of play for the Hurricanes. A length ball which nips back and takes him in front of middle and off. The wheels are coming off for the Sixers
full outside off, driven to deep cover

what a delivery! And he bring out the somersault celebration. That's a classical legspinners dismissal as it pitches on middle, spins to beat the edge and takes off stump. What a gem, what a turnaround
huge appeal for a stumping and he's gone! A sharply-spun leg-break, beats Abbott's edge as he comes forward. Superbly swift work from McDermott and the foot is in the air above the line
a length ball that skids on, worked through the leg side
through him! He has another, amazing stuff. Beautiful bowling, round the wicket, pitches well outside off and spins back sharply as Dwarshuis leaves a huge gap
on off stump, length ball, defended
fuller, he defends on the front foot
full outside off, driven to mid-off
terrific yorker, 147kph, jabbed to the off side
a strangled appeal for lbw, it was full and straight, must have been saved by an inside edge...yep, big nick
beaten outside off
good length on the stumps, 145kph, defended to the bowler
fuller, straight, flicked to mid-on
low full toss as he tosses this up, driven to deep cover and Silk is able to get back for the second
short of a length, straight, whipped off the back foot to midwicket
full outside off, driven to deep cover but they don't run
full at leg stump, tucked off the pads into midwicket
out with a direct hit! But Qais misses...was tapped to the on side, Qais went across from his follow through
short and wide, half an appeal for an edge
googly, tapped to the leg side
length ball outside off, he slashes and misses
driven to deep cover and another run turned down...Silk feeling he has to do most of this
huge appeal for a caught behind, not given! Short of a length, went for the pull, Hobart convinced there's a bottom edge. Looks like he has hit that
length ball outside off, angled into backward point
full and straight, solidly defended...nine dot ball for Manenti now
full, driven back down the pitch. Just one run off the over
driven off the back foot wide of cover and there's no run despite it being on offer
shorter, he rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
width outside off, square cut to the cover sweeper and it's another dot
dragged down very short, Qais' bouncer! Pulled to deep square and runs this time
comes forward and defends
spins away outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, driven out to deep cover and placed well enough for a couple
slower ball, full outside off, gets an inside edge into his boot and on this occasion they take the run
touch too straight, neatly flicked off the pads to long leg
full outside off, another slower ball, swung into midwicket
back of a length at off stump, heaved to deep midwicket
this slower ball grips considerably, takes Silk on the back pad. Not entirely sure why they didn't appeal.
length ball outside off, driven to mid-off for a scampered run
full at off stump, carved to deep cover
full and straight, gets a thick inside edge towards fine leg
keeps it full at the stumps, pushed down the ground to long-on
a yorker at leg stump, flicked to deeps square leg
full at the pads, clipped through midwicket and Silk spots there's the chance for a second
length ball outside off, a slower ball, he swings and gets a bottom edge that bobbles back to the keeper
length ball, another cutter, not much timing as he swings to midwicket
on the stumps, heaved to deeps square leg
gets himself room outside leg and drives to cover, would have been close with a direct hit...would have been well out, in fact
connects this time! Drops it short, that's a powerful pull which goes well back into the stand at deep square
full at off stump, swung to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, connects crisply again with a pull but finds deep midwicket
good length at the stumps, swatted down to long-on...singles are fine for Hobart
aiming for the yorker, it's a low full toss at off stump, driven square through point
down the leg side but it's just a single as he flicks it backward of square
full toss outside off, square drives through backward point, Short gets around to prevent the boundary
slower ball, full outside off, shoveled to deep square leg
great catch, that's the match! Full and straight, Silk plays effectively a slog sweep, doesn't get far off the ground and Short does brilliantly at deep square to take it low at the ground.
full outside off, clubbed out to deep midwicket
slower ball, full outside off, pushed to the covers
back-of-the-hand slower ball, very full outside off, he plays over the top of it
and that's it! He moves all around his crease then just manages to slice this to short third man
